statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Tim Abromaitis came out of his early season 3-point shooting slump to score 26 points, leading Notre Dame to an easy 97-72 win over Maine Monday night.
article.headline: Tim Abromaitis breaks out as ND cruises past Maine
article.linkText: Abromaitis breaks out as ND cruises past Maine
article.story: SOUTH BEND, Ind. -- Tim Abromaitis came out of his early season 3-point shooting slump to score 26 points, leading Notre Dame to an easy 97-72 win over Maine Monday night. Abromaitis tallied 17 of his points in a perfect first half when he went 5-5 from the field (including three 3-pointers and 4-4 from the free-throw line. The senior was 4-for-5 from 3-point range against Maine; he had been 4-for-24 from beyond the arc entering Monday. Scott Martin scored 15 points and Tyrone Nash had 13 points and 11 rebounds for the Irish (4-0). Jack Cooley also scored 13 points, Ben Hansbrough had 11 points and nine assists and Carleton Scott scored 11. Gerald McLemore scored 16 to lead Maine (2-2). Troy Barnies had 15 points and Raheem Singleton 12. Notre Dame next travels to Orlando for the Old Spice Classic and a meeting with Georgia on Thanksgiving Day.
